snippet: In spite of the daily chaos, conflict and crisis, 20- and 30-somethings insist that Ukraine has a brighter future in store, and they say they can build it.
abstract: Ukrainians in their 20s and 30s remain optimistic about their country's future despite conflict, crumbling economy, troubled transitional government and threat of further Russian encroachment; young people express satisfaction with changes that have occurred so far, and are looking forward to upcoming national elections, citing a desire to rebuild their nation.
lead_paragraph: In spite of the daily chaos, conflict and crisis, 20- and 30-somethings insist that Ukraine has a brighter future in store, and they say they can build it.

headline.main: Young Ukrainians Brush Aside the Crisis and Voice Optimism About the Future
headline.print_headline: Young Ukrainians Brush Aside the Crisis and Voice Optimism About the Future
